title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 16-l - Order of remand
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 16-l - Order of remand

State Regulations
C.P.L. Article 730
FORM 16-l
12/88
ORDER OF REMAND
________ COURT OF ________
COUNTY OF ________
________x
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, ORDER OF REMAND
- against -
Indictment No. ________, Defendant. ________x

The above named defendant, having been
indicted for or convicted of the felony of ________, in violation of ________, and such defendant having been adjudicated and committed to the custody of the

Commissioner of (OMH) (OMRDD), to be placed in an appropriate facility by order
of this court dated ________, and such defendant being now in the custody of
said Commissioner and confined in ________ facility, located at ________ and an
application, dated ________, having been received from ________, the person in
charge of the facility where the defendant is confined, for an order of
retention of said defendant, and notice of such application having been given
to the defendant, the District Attorney, and the Mental Hygiene Legal

Service, AND a hearing having been held on the ________
day of ________ and the following persons having appeared ____________
____________
AND it appearing to my satisfaction that the
said defendant has the capacity to understand the proceedings against (him)
(her) and to aid in (his) (her) own defense and is no longer an incapacitated
person. It is therefore, ORDERED, that the criminal action against the
defendant shall proceed and the defendant is remanded to the custody of the
(County Sheriff) (Commissioner of Correction of the City of New York). Dated: ________
_________
Judge or Justice

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form
16-l

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
